Message.Title: Why is stock so so cheap in its pps?
Message.Msg: Makes very little sense, apple is growing 20% a year or better And it trades for 14.3 x earnings, using ttm. Back out cash and it trades for 12 or slightly less. Forward PE is even lower with 12 .9 x earnings and backing out cash is 10.7 x earnings. Maybe, it can pop 150 points in a day!

Topic.Title: Why is stock so so cheap in its pps?

Message.Msg: AAPL has traded at about 4x sales for several years. Earnings have been growing faster than sales, thus the P/E compression. The P/E has compressed from about 32 in 2009 to less than 15 today, which is less than the P/E of the S&P 500, at about 16. To my mind, this spells the end of the P/E compression cycle, or very nearly the end. In the coming year, the stock should advance in relation to earnings and not sales (very good news for shareholders).

Message.Title: I went swimming with my iPhone on the 4th of July...another reason Apple dominates
Message.Msg: Went swimming with my iphone 4s on the 4th, unintentionally of course. I put it in my pocket, forgot about it and dove in TWICE before I realized what I had done. The wife was Johnny on the spot & removed the sim card & shook out the water & promptly buried it into a bag of rice. I went ahead and replaced it with a new iPhone and found out Verizon is now abandoning their unlimited data plan on upgrades effective June 28th, 2012. Also their $50 off the 4s ended at the end of June. Just my luck one week late. However, Target has a 14 day return no restock fee. Okay, so I got the new phone activated & waited 3 days on the rice. Voilla! Old iPhone is resurrected. Checked out the functions & only issues are the front facing camera is not working. Rear camera works. The front camera worked for a couple shots initially, then I tried the flashlight ap and I think the front light burned out. (Btw the front light was on solid when I got out of the pool & didnt go off until the battery drained in the rice) Anyway, still salvageable, so I returned the new phone, re-activated the upgrade, & restarted the unlimited data. PS simply Worthless new Yahoo message boards

Topic.Title: Prediction: July 24 End of Day Price?

Message.Title: Gabeli reitrates is 1170$ target check this out based on 14 PE 2013 numbers
Message.Msg: Several analysts this morning re-affirm their faith in the company, with previews of what to expected when the company report fiscal Q3 on July 24th. Consensus for Q3 is $37.65 billion in revenue and $10.39 per share in profit, according to FactSet. Apple shares this morning are up $3.24, or 0.5%, at $608.21 in a rather weak market. Some of today’s note contain cuts in iPhone, Mac, or iPad estimates, though they are all fairly upbeat on Apple in general: Hendi Susanto, Gabelli & Co.: Reiterates a Buy rating and a “present market value” of $1,170 per share based on 14 times 2013 projected earnings. Susanto cut iPad sales estimates to 14.8 million units last quarter from a prior 15.5 million-unit projection given macroeconomic woes. Susanto is now modeling revenue of $38.8 billion in the quarter and $10.55 per share. Susanto also cut Mac estimates on dour PC data, and cut iPhone estimates because of a pause in buying ahead of the new model. As for the iPad “Mini” rumors, Susanto writes “While many think that mini iPads will cannibalize sales of iPads, we believe that mini iPads can open up new market opportunities such as portable automobile media consoles, navigation systems, and portable video game consoles.” Gene Munster, Piper Jaffray: Reiterates an Overweight rating and a $910 price target. He sees 28 million to 29 million iPhone units last quarter, above consensus of 25 million to 27 million units, and 16 million iPad units, which he thinks is in line with consensus. Still, it will be difficult for Apple to achieve its customary outperformance in the June quarter of 6%, which would be roughly $39.7 billion. He models $37.1 billion and $10.19 per share in profit. “Assuming Apple guides the September quarter consistent with past guides since 2006 (2% downside to revenue & 9% downside to EPS) implies $36.3b and $8.97 EPS (Street $37.1b & $9.86 EPS for June). However, we expect a more conservative guide than usual because of our belief that the iPhone 5 will launch in October, while the Street has mixed expectations in terms of timing.” Matthew Hoffman, Cowen & Co.: Reiterates an Outperform rating. He sees $37.82 billion and $10.16 per share. He’s modeling iPad sales of 18.5 million, “based on our surveys showing consumer preferences shifting toward tablets, especially iPads, and PC datapoints which appear to confirm that trend.” Hoffman models iPhone sales down 20%, quarter over quarter. As for Q4, “the largest variable in our model is how to shape the next iPhone’s ramp. Our model still has ~5MM new iPhones in F4Q12, helping to keep unit sales roughly flat q/q (in the 28-29MM range; we believe consensus is higher in June and lower in September).” William Power, R.W. Baird: Reiterates an Outperform rating and a $740 price target, with “checks still positive” as regards iPhone sales. He models $36.2 billion in revenue but raised his EPS estimate to $10.19 from $9.90. “We forecast the U.S. carriers to sell roughly 7 million iPhones in FQ3. If the U.S. represented 25% of iPhone shipments, vs. 26% last quarter, that would imply 28 million iPhone shipments – just one proxy.” He models 25.1 million iPhone units for Q4, which would be below the consensus 27 million. Apple probably sold 15.3 million iPads last quarter.

Message.Title: 600 should hold from now on
Message.Msg: At a price of 600., AAPL shares sell for 11.0X the consensus EPS through September 2013. And as we know that is usually a conservative estimate based this time on 46 analysts reporting mean EPS of about 54.41 for the 12 months ending September 2013. This new Apple fiscal year begins in only 10 weeks from today. What happens between now and September 2013 in terms of AAPL price action? I think we see some rise prior to the July 24 release, perhaps to the 630. area. Then I can see moderation from whatever post earnings release price level we get, say in a range of 630-650 depending on how big a beat. Then there will be talk about a mediocre 4th quarter because of delayed iPhone purchases. But I do not see all that great a sell-off in the shares even with a seasonally weak stock market into the fall months. Why? Too much to discount on any drop back to the 600. level which is the base line value number. We can look forward to: the new iPhone, a contract with China Mobile, the new iPad mini, the dividend and buyback announcement, and possibly some preview of the new Apple TV. That is a lot of fire power going forward. Then following a seasonally slow period for the stock market this fall, the shares can slowly gravitate higher and approach 700 by the first quarter of calendar 2013. For the rest of the fiscal 2013 period I can see a rise to 750 which is about 13.0X a more realistic EPS estimate of 57.50 for the 12 months ending September 2013. Big J in L.A .(retired security analyst, The Foristall Co., member The Los Angeles Society of Security Analysts)

Topic.Title: Obama is toast in November!

Message.Msg: Smooth talking may get your foot-in-the-door (or - The Presidency), but sound economic policies will keep your seat in the oval office. Obama'$ economic policies are anti-business owner and do NOT promote growth, evidenced by a stalled-growth cycle, the slowest economic recovery in decades. America does NOT need a smooth talker, but NEEDS a leader with sound economic policies. Owebama = Entitlement Society - Dependent on Government handouts; Success and hard work is PUNISHED with high taxes; Government limits YOUR FREEDOM with intrusive regulations throughout society, disjointing the financial markets, etc. etc. Romney = Capitalism - Self-reliance and incentives for "Capital-Creation" such as a low tax burden, few government regulations, USA Energy Independence (using OUR resources, not importing/sending OUR money overseas), etc. The choice is clear. If you hate America and want to see America changed into a European-style Socialist Society, then vote Owebama. If you appreciate the fact that FREEDOM unleashed in America has changed the world for the better through innovation, investment and job creation, then vote Romney. Ronald Reagan gave America hope again after the miserable Carter years. I truly believe that Romney's business experience may SAVE AMERICA from the miserable, stalled-growth economic recovery we are now experiencing. If you use your brain in the voting booth in November, then the choice is clear. American did not become an economic superpower on the backs of a big, beloated debt-spending Federal Government. America became great because of Entrepreneurs like Steve Jobs & Woz forming a business in a garage....taking a risk to do something great!
